etymology.description: 阴(陰) (yīn, "yin; shadow"), 道(道) (dào, "path; way"), 炎(炎) (yán, "inflammation; flame")
etymology.interpretation: 阴道炎(陰道炎) (yīndàoyán, "vaginitis") combines 阴(陰) (yīn, "yin; shadow"), 道(道) (dào, "path; way"), and 炎(炎) (yán, "inflammation; flame") to describe an inflammation of the vaginal path in the body. The characters reflect the concept of a 'shadow path' referring to parts related to internal or hidden organs, with 'inflammation' indicating a medical condition.

examples.chinese: 她因感染而患上阴道炎(她因感染而患上陰道炎)，医生建议她及时治疗(醫生建議她及時治療)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīn gǎnrǎn ér huàn shàng yīndàoyán, yīshēng jiànyì tā jíshí zhìliáo.
examples.english: She contracted vaginitis due to an infection, and her doctor advised prompt treatment.

examples.chinese: 她出现阴道炎的症状(她出現陰道炎的症狀)，需及早就医(需及早就醫)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chūxiàn yīndàoyán de zhèngzhuàng, xū jízǎo jiùyī.
examples.english: She exhibited symptoms of vaginitis and needs to seek medical attention early.
